title: Reasons For Seasons
lyrics: It's big TM, leanin' off the Seagrams
Eyes bloodshot, look at 'em and you'll see him
Now who he's become but his mother's son?
The same one who avoided guns and picked up the drums
Had you marchin' to a different beat, stood you on your feet
I looked out, helped you off the streets
I gave you advice to heed, a new life to lead
In return, you took my kindness for weak
When I was at my lowest, truest colors started showin'
Niggas I called friends wasn't answerin' they phone then
Huh, that's when Quik words rang true
Be careful who you hand your celebrity to, uh
Didn't get it 'til that very instance
Since then, between me and them, I put a little distance
Niggas so lame for sayin', "Bro, it's a shame"
Disloyal like a ho, sold your soul for this game and you still broke, nigga
Sometimes, people go as quick as they come
They say that there's nothing new under the sun
'Cause time reveals all our reasons
Things change in life just like seasons
Little Kendrick from the Hub
Can show you that my motives always been to give you love
I'm puttin' out good music in return to build a buzz
That's bigger than life itself or some Bubble Kush plug
Won't you look in the mirror?
You see a pair of eyes that's quite similar to mines
And if you do, that shit should scare ya
Baby brother of Compton, tryna accomplish
The impossible, with obstacles at my daily grindin'
Oh no, here come the critics, but not from the magazines, I mean
The blocks that were so-called mad at me, they're mean
'Cause soon as success is in my favor
They'll try to break down my character like I ain't from their heritage
Quite frankly
It'd hurt my soul to hear a nigga that I know talkin' bad and tryna play me
Like we ain't had pellet gunfights, fallin' off of minibikes
In the Buick, bumpin' Clipse with no AC
Why would you shame me?
Sometimes, people go as quick as they come
They say that there's nothing new under the sun
'Cause time reveals all our reasons
Things change in life just like seasons
Yeah, mm
So I was drivin' home last night on the 101 freeway and I look up
And it's a sign that says, "Love your friends and love your family"
And I thought to myself, why do we use these words so loose? Love, friends, and family
I mean if love is involved, why do friends and family hurt us, and why do we hurt them?
It's kinda like we all forgot the true definition of love to begin with, tuh
The one thing I do know, I nor you can be accountable what somebody else does to us
We can only be accountable for what we do to them
So instead of sayin', "That's my friend," "That's my family," and, "It's love," huh
I'ma say this to y'all
So many words we say in vain
What are we really sayin'?
People never change
Truth won't be the same
